Reviews.Title: “Good value if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: Tadams977
Reviews.Content: Rooms in need of a re-vamp. Service is friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and a good price! My new favorite in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen M
Reviews.Content: This was a better deal than staying at either Jericho or SameSun hostels. It can be difficult to find a quiet hotel room anywhere in Vancouver, but THIS IS IT! Finally a place where I can sleep like a baby without hearing a party going on in the street below. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, the shower down the hall was clean and had great water pressure and hot enough water. Downstairs there's a nice living room area with couches, a bookshelf full of travel and other books, free coffee and (I think) wifi. The desk staff was courteous and helpful. We were able to leave our bags for several hours while we wandered around before our flight left the next day. Stanley Park is also very closeby. I am the first to complain if there are problems. Buchan exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jlv22
Reviews.Content: I got a room on the first floor and it was nice, clean and comfortable. I used the shared shower (which no one ever used but me it seems!) but had a toilet and sink in my room. The toilet was a convenient suprise as I payed for only the basic room. It was also more reasonably priced as I stayed there in the off season. The West End is a lovely area. Wireless provided for a reasonable fee (around $2 a day). Provides free tea and coffee in the morning and there are lots of pamphlets and suggestions of things to do. It's close to Stanley Park and Robson St and not too difficult to get to other attractions in downtown Vancouver. It might be just me but I found the bus system a little difficult at first but that has nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great location, welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: dean C
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant stay at the Buchan. Staff friendly and helpful, very knowledgable about the local area and even allowed us to extend our stay by an extra night. The front room is full of pamphlets, maps and information about what to do in Vancouver. The staff were available 24 hours a day and were always polite. Our room was big, clean, quiet and comfortable. We had cable tv with a vast amount of channels and fast wifi Internet. There was a walk in wardrobe and drawers for storage. We used the shared bathroom which was always available and clean. Room service was brilliant, the cleaners are very friendly and always made sure we were provided with clean towels and linen. We also used the washer and dryer in the hotel which was modern and powerful, very cheap.Free coffee and tea in the morning was helpful, and enjoyable. The location was the best part, a very short walk from stanley park, Robson street and English bay. We walked every where.. Very easy to get to from the greyhound, take the number 19 bus. Absolutely brilliant, thank you for a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect simple room in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas_2207
Reviews.Content: This place was great! I felt like I was staying in a piece of history. The room and hotel itself is very basic and old, but well maintained and very clean. It also has an exceptional location in the best neighborhood in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but Clean, in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Macloo
Reviews.Content: No elevator! Not even one! There are also stairs leading up from the street to the lobby. No ramp. Just a note that may be important to some travelers. By "shabby," I mean the furniture is really old, and was not great quality to begin with. Think: chain motel style. However, the bed was firm, the pillows were acceptable, and everything was very clean. There was a ceiling fan (no AC). My room had a private bath. The shower had fantastic water pressure (hooray!). The towels were big and fluffy (unlike motel quality!). It was quiet. The staff were all helpful and friendly. I chose this hotel for two nights because I wanted to spend a long day in Stanley Park. For that, the location was ideal. I was able to walk to dozens of really good ethnic restaurants on Denman Street -- where there are also many bike rental places. If you walk to the end of Denman, you can turn south and walk along the water all the way to the ferry that goes to the Public Market on Granville Island. A great walk!

Reviews.Title: “Staff friendly but room not!”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelinFools
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night only, thank goodness. We had what was called an executive double room for $154. For the price, I expected better accommodations. The beds were horrible. You could almost feel the springs through them - that's how old they must have been! Also, our private bath was SO small, that nether my husband nor I could enter the space next to the tub/shower where the sink was, without turning sideways! Our shoulders were literally too big to get straight in.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: H W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times and have always had a pleasant stay. This is your typical european style hotel. There are no frills but just the basic necessities that a normal hotel guest needs. I've stayed here several times over the years and have always had great iteractions with the staff. They have always been very accomodating. Two things I would recommend to the hotel is to update the communal shower/bath areas and replace the bedspreads which have been there for as long as I can remember. A traveler won't regret staying here if they aren't expecting the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: morts109
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at the Buchan in July- what I liked was its location - its easy to walk to Stanley Park in one direction and to the central part of the city and harbourside on the other. Despite being very central its down a side street which means that its quiet. Staff are friendly and the room was ok although not the best. I had a private room which was comfortable enough but its not the cleanest of places and the general decor needs updating. Also, my room was directly next to some communal bathrooms which meant I got disturbed quite often. In conclusion, I think its good enough for the price but there are also better options for the money

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for UBC to Stanley Park Half Marathon”
Reviews.Author: 05toes
Reviews.Content: Sunday, June 26, 2011 — UBC to Stanley Park, Vancouver, BC http://www.canadarunningseries.com/svhm/index.htm The Buchan Hotel is 800 m from Expo and early morning Shuttle Pick Up 10mn Walk from Finishing line , the Famous Stanley Park So IDEALLY Located .... They provide very clean room thus Basic amazingly quiet , Paid (2$) Fast Wifi access . NO Breakfast . just Coffee The reception is very friendly and helpful . Early Morning ( 4.30 am ) coffee was not ready .. usually from 6 am but they agreed in providing Boiled Water .. and They DID .... so we could make and have our Own Coffee in the Room .. We liked the place we stayed 3 nights during our first stay ( room 32 ) then 3 more nights ( room 32 as well ) a month later. They have Rooms with shared Bathroom and Toilets as well as in-suite Rooms such as room 39 for those who need more Comfort The area is Safe . 5 mn walk to a Bunch of Cheap and Good Asian and Ethnic restaurants Bottom line : we will sleep there again if needed Tip: If online reservation seems to be fully booked don't hesitate to contact them they have " Hidden Rooms"

Reviews.Title: “Basic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gorilla60
Reviews.Content: Great area close to Stanley park and out of the city slightly, great for exploring the park. Unfortunately no ramp into the hotel, had to climb and carry up cases just to get through the doors to reception about 6 in all. Not good with heavy cases!!! Booking in was ok but then found out no lift so had to cart the heavy cases now up flights of stairs. Not fun and all, a bit of a work out to say the least.....Room very basic and in need of an lick of pain. No toilet paper provided in room (obviously overlooked)and no fridge and no coffee/tea making facilities- couldn't believe it..There was pot of coffee always on in the communial lounge area but would have been nicer in the room. Wouldn't take much.Unfortunately stayed there the night of the canucks riot so was fairly noisy in the street, could have been worse though could have been more in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the money.”
Reviews.Author: jonnyac
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The shared bathroom wasn't an issue as they have plenty on each floor.The staff are helpful and friendly. The location is perfect for every part of Vancouver and you're only 2 minutes walk from Stanley Park. The room was clean and had all necessary amenities.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Totalchaos58
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay,close to everything,two blocks from Stanley Park abd you cannot beat the price!!75 a night,it doesn't get any cheaper for a hotel in downtown Vancouver. It's an older building,and we had a standard room with shared bathroom down the hallway ,which was no problem,never had to wait ,bathroom and showers were always free!hotel is on a quiet residential street,so it was perfect,you don't even feel like you are downtown. The staff are extremely nice and helpful, they are great!! Rooms are plain and simple ,but when you're there to see Vancouver,who cares about the room! You're only in it to sleep anyhow :). since it was an older building,you could hear alot ,like other people walking around upstairs,so if you're a light sleeper you may want to stay on the top floor. No air conditioners in the rooms,but we did have two fans,and barely needed to use them,was not too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Greenwillow
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were treated great. The woman was the nicest person I've ever delt with at a hotel. Finding a parking place was very difficult, so unless you are prepared to walk far and to drive long to find a place don't bring a car. We only needed a room for one night so this place was a good choice. However we found it hard to sleep since the bed was uncomfortable and our room was right by the bathroom so it woke us up whenever someone went to use it. The room was clean though, no dirty towels or bed bugs, and having a sink in the room helped. The location was great, can walk to a lot of places. The neighborhood was very nice and you felt safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Even budgets should have standards!”
Reviews.Author: TEBY910
Reviews.Content: Very dirty- came home covered in bed bug bites. Towels had 'crusties' on them. No phone, no alarm. And didn't feel at all safe. Shared bathrooms were marginally cleaner than the private ones.

Reviews.Title: “Dormitory Living”
Reviews.Author: erfiedawerfie
Reviews.Content: FIRST: KNOW WHAT YOU ARE GETTING INTO HERE. Charming? Um, that's not the word that comes to mind... GOOD POINTS: Okay, yes, the location of this hotel couldn't be better- off the main street two blocks, tree lighted and small park across the strett, in a beautiful and quiet residential neighborhood. The West End is a five minute walk, as is #1 English Bay Beach. A MILLION medium priced restaurants start 2 blocks away. Safeway, three short blocks, the library two. Bus connections to EVERYWHERE in Vancouver, just 2 blocks away, and Vancouver has STELLAR public transportation. Probably the best situated hotel in town for a tourist visitor. Our room in the corner of the 3rd floor was quiet. The staff was 24 hours, very friendly and helpful. NOT SO GOOD: 1) No elevator. 2) No phone. 3) No hot water maker coffee pot in the small cramped room. (Pay phone in lobby, coffee and hot water in lobby). 4) No air-conditioning 5) Slow Wireless Internet 4) Below average (or worse) room: The bed was cheap, small, and firm, and not particularly big- Queen? Don't think so, probably a full. The furniture is cheap college dorm, the bathroom adequate, but no electric next to the mirror even. The TV is small 18" flat screen digital BUT with analog signal 10 feet from the head of the bed- so yeah, small fuzzy picture. Enough to fall asleep to. One wall outlet turned off along with the room wall switched light, leaving one hard to get at plug behind the TV. The bathroom heat could not be turned off, and no hot bath water at 3 AM. Was fine in regular evening. No air conditioning, just a fan. Probably unbearable in hot weather. We lucked out. Needed paint and patch up of holes in bathroom wall. The bed was cheap, small, and firm, and not particularly big- Queen? Don't think so, probably a full. At night, if everyone is online in the hotel, the internet is useless. Slowwwww. I had to walk 2 blocks to an all night coffee shop to get work done one night. This is not even a decent Motel 6 in regards to room presentation. For us, I had to return a broken TV to exchange for a good one, toilet paper roll fell apart (we managed to fix). I would imagine in hot weather, the room would be unbearable- no air conditioning. SUMMARY: Are you vacationing for the hotel room or the city? For us, the room was nothing more that a place to crash in after a full day of activity outside the hotel. So it worked. It was a nice place to stay- once we left the room- because the location is indeed perfect. However, the room isn't a place you want to do anything but fall asleep in. It ain't pretty. The Silvia is a better place, albeit more money a few blocks away with most of the advantages of the Buchan's location, although the Silvia is a stones throw from the main street one block over, and might not be absolutely as quiet with traffic. I'm guessing Siliva has phones and elevators, and revamped rooms at a little more money. Price them both out. You get what you pay for. Frankly, I think the Buchan is still overpriced for what it delivers. As I understand it, this hotel is run by a bunch of Dentists-- and they are cheap arses to not put a little more money into this place. I mean, come on, paint it even. I've seen better college dorms than this-- fortunately, the quality of our vacation hinged little on the quality of our room at the Buchan. Probably the cheapest deal in town for a good located hotel. So, take your pick- this or the Silvia for a bit more money. Only Recommended with strong reservations about the quality of these accommodations. In hot weather, I think I would pass, just because of lack of air conditioning-- but how hot does Vancouver get, and when? Don't even know if the Silvia has air.... CHECK DETAILS.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Habermas
Reviews.Content: We arrived late 10pm (1am our time) and had to wait easily 15-20 minutes while the clerk dealt with guests ahead of us (who were getting change and laundry soap and not checking in), which was a little annoying, but probably more so because I was exhausted. When we got to our room the first word that came to mind was “dismal”. If I wasn’t exhausted, if it wasn’t so late, if I had more money, I probably would have turned around. Instead I crawled into bed and closed my eyes against the ugliness. I will say that the bed was comfortable. The next morning we went to Stanley Park – the location *almost* makes up for the hotel itself. It was just minutes until we reached the park. Additionally, the area surrounding the hotel is amazing – there are tons of fantastic restaurants offering diverse cuisine. The room was relatively newly painted. The furniture is mismatched – like a dorm room from the sixties. The bathroom is definitely outdated. There was one socket in the room, which made it impossible to run the fan (there is no air conditioning, which kind of sucked during a heat wave), tv and recharge our phones. There is no phone in the room. Internet access is expensive. Oh, and someone has made the poorest choice of window treatments ever. The curtains didn’t even close let alone keep light out. I paper-clipped them shut each night to try to keep some light out. I guess my advice for making the place nicer would be to work with what you have. Meaning, the rooms are awkwardly sized and furnished – so rather than painting everything cream, paint the rooms in funky colours and play up the hotel’s uniqueness. There are lots of boutique hotels that do just that. I realize this is a budget hotel, but you can repaint fairly cheaply and – at least cosmetically – remove some of the dreariness from the room. Budget doesn’t have to mean ugly. Finally, on the budget point. For probably $10-$20 more per night we could have stayed at a much nicer hotel. In the end, it really wasn’t much of a deal staying here. Overall, the hotel experience – room, amenities, rate – were extremely disappointing, which is too bad because the location is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, great location and cheap”
Reviews.Author: jamesl_1985
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great value hotel in Vancouver this is a great place. I stayed here in August with my girlfriend, we were a bit apprehensive about the shared bathroom but this turned out to be fine, always very clean, never a wait. The rooms were basic - two double beds, a sink and small tv - but clean. Staff here very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. Location is fantastic in a quite, attractive residential street a couple of blocks from English Bay and Stanley Park, lively local streets with good value restaurants, the main bus route down towards Gastown. Would highly recommend to those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and very pleasant, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jopetom
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are most hospitable, helpful and knowledgeable about their city and other places that we would be visiting. Very quiet location although rooms a little warm at night. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy place, but luxury it ain't!”
Reviews.Author: eurorover
Reviews.Content: Four-night stay on room-only basis as part of tour to Canada. First the good points; the hotel staff are most hospitable, helpful and knowledgeable about their city, so getting around is no problem. The hotel is situated in a peaceful locn. a block from Stanley Park, 500m from English beach, and on a bus route for North Vanc. and Capilano. Also bars and restaurants 200m away. The downtown area is a bus ride but walkable in 25-mins. Bad points; the rooms while cosy with a lot of English floral patterns, not all have en-suites. Our bathroom although tidy, had a constant whiff of mildew, which was prevalent around the bath and on the shower curtain. Plug sockets were a bit loose, and nestling under the bedside table were fingernail clippings from a previous occupant. There was no lift, so lugging 20kg bags (x 4) proved a bit energy sapping for me. Also, on one of the landings was this dreadful stench of an open sewer or a foul waste drain from outside which drifted into parts of the hotel. General points; a great city which has a lot of things to see and do. Still many areas/metro brand-spanking new after 2010 Winter Olympics. Is a tad more expensive than most Canadian cities, really on par with back home cost-wise. The city has a high profile gay/lesbian scene, and in the Gastown area near the water, is not unlike San Francisco, but without the hills. The hotel was meant as a budget stop, and budget was what we got. Other factors contributed to a positive opinion of the place, which importantly, should be borne in mind if stopping here. However, the city itself and its people, are well worth the time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.....”
Reviews.Author: nanatee
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Vancouver after spending 3 nights at The Buchan Hotel. There are positives and negatives that i thought would be helpful to share. First, the positives: - great location in the West End-- you can walk to Stanley Park and all the stores near by, including a great Safeway supermarket - Haro street is very quiet and picturesque - the Hotel staff were very accomodating ( more about that below) - there is a wonderful restaurant next door, the Adesso. They serve Northern Italian food which is delicious. Not cheap but nice for a special treat! - there is a nice sitting room across from the front desk- a cozy place to read, etc. Newspapers are provided as is hot water and tea bags. Now the negatives: - There is no elevator in the hotel so if you're on the third floor, you have to lug your bags up - There is no a/c which for our week, was a problem because it was particularly warm. There were ceiling fans but they didn't cool the room down much. After one sweltering night, we requested 2 rooms on the first floor. The staff had us pack up our bags and they moved them downstairs for us. Another strange thing in the bathrooms..you have to step up into them because they're not even with the floor. My daughter tripped one time because they didn't warn us about this|! - the bathrooms smelled funky and are in need of renovation- the glaze on our tub was coming off. (this was on the third floor) - no phones or clock radios in any of the rooms. Was a pain when you needed the time or to phone- there is a pay phone by the front desk but calls are obviously, no privacy! I would recommend this hotel to someone who doesn't mind a bare-bones establishement. The price and location are the best things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service!”
Reviews.Author: KSBelle
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Buchan... last year after a cruise and this year after trans-continental train trip. The location can't be beat unless you want to be on the waterfront and spend more money. The rooms are plain but clean and fairly quiet... ours had two double beds, desk, dresser, bedside table and flat screen TV. We were on the first floor above the restaurant so it was a little noisy until about 11pm. The bath linens were plush while the amenities were average. Good shower water pressure and the exhaust fan a nice addition. No phone in the room - no wake up call available. Also, we did not have an outlet in the bathroom. There is no air conditioning but there are fans in the rooms. That was sufficient both last September and this July. If you are addicted to air conditioning, this may not be your place. They have added a board in the lobby that lists all current cultural activities - I told the reception staff that I appreciated it. Also in the lobby are coffee and daily newspapers. Tea is also available as are lots of tourist information brochures. We used the laundry facilities - $2.00/load to wash and $1.25 to dry... desk had change available and they sold detergent. The hotel is in a quiet, residential area close to both English Bay and Coal Harbour - we were within a 5 to 10 minute stroll each. And 3 minutes away from busy Denman Street with all of its varied restaurants (African, Ukrainian, Greek, Indian, Sushi for a few) and bike rentals. Safeway Market is about 1 and 1/2 blocks away. We walked from the Buchan to Stanley Park - about 2 blocks away - to attend Theatre Under the Stars - great activity during this time of the year - and it was an easy jaunt up and down hills. In room Wi-Fi was available for $2.00/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: schlop
Reviews.Content: Buchan Hotel is situated in a quiet part of Haro Street within the Westend and you can reach Stanley Park and Downtown within minutes either by feet or by bus respectively. So the location is just great. We had a room with a shared bathroom, which was fine, although the managment of the Buchan could think about renovating the showers. Don't forget to bring your flip-flops anyway. We paid 86 CAD per night for two persons, which is a good deal when you look at most of the other hotels in Vancouver. I would stay there again and hope on being able to do so soon. Canada, eh?

Reviews.Title: “Excelent budget hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: GabiG3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year after our cruise to Alaska. It was great we found this place at such a good price and in a perfect area. Stanley Park is 10 minutes walking, tennis courts very close, Robson St is just a few blocks away. The building is old but in a very good condition. The only bad thing is that it does not have elevator. It was not a matter for us but it may be for people with heavy luggage. This area is a residential area, very safe and you can feel very quickly as if this hotel is your home. We had a double room with private bathroom and it was super clean all of it: the bed sheets as well as the bathroom. This hotel really made us feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget, this place is great”
Reviews.Author: guppy320
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel which is on a quiet block in the West End neighborhood. The location was outstanding! Stanley Park was nearby, mass transportation could be picked up blocks away, or you can walk to sights easily. Also nearby the hotel are numerous restaraunts to take advantage of at night. The room was small but clean and it worked for us for the price we paid (we had a private bathroom). The only thing we really complained about to each other was the lack of a telephone and wi-fi access in our room. The lack of free wi-fi was the most disappointing. The staff was always available and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel for family & friends on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for down town Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Gannochy
Reviews.Content: As a single traveller I found this hotel basic but just what I needed as a base for a week long stay in downtown Van Not the most modern decor and I was not a fan of the shared bathrooms, but apart from that it was excellent

Reviews.Title: “So lucky to have found this gem”
Reviews.Author: mohicans
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I knew it would be difficult to find an affordable hotel in Vancouver for the 1st weekend of the Winter Olympics - but thanks to the Buchan hotel and a bit of luck - we were successful. This is a budget hotel - the rooms are small, the building is old - but it is absolutely clean - the linens are fresh and nice - the beds are comfortable, the staff is outstanding - the location is amazing - and the price is perfect. We had a heavy suitcase so we were delighted to be on the main floor and didn't have to use the stairs. Denman Street is 2 blocks away - where there are LOADS of restaurant choices to fit every taste and budget. This hotel is on a quiet, residential street - and we welcomed the quiet after attending the very exciting Olympic events. From this hotel we were able to walk to BC Place, Robson Square, Stanley Park & the Aquarium and to the shops veering off in the many directions. We are so grateful that this hotel made the Olympic dream possible for us. We definitely plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable rates, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: camperkat
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little hotel is located in a quiet residential area just a few blocks from Stanley Park. It has no elevator and some of the rooms are European plan, so we are talking no frill here. There is a wonderful restaurant next door and it is just a few blocks from the West End shopping district. I only stayed one night, but the staff on both shifts I encountered were incredibly nice and very helpful. I would definitely stay return.

Reviews.Title: “When it is steamy summer”
Reviews.Author: ErikTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: The upper floor is far too hot when temperatures rise. No aircon here. Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DeepBluSea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our travel to Alaska. There are many young people, so if you want to socialize it's the right place. The Hotel it's a little old, but our room was very clean. It's very easy to walk to the Stanley Park and downtown from it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: timitart
Reviews.Content: Good location, helpful and nice staff, hotel a bit tired around the edges. Bed comfortable, but room a bit noisy and with a slight musty smell. Bathroom had some mould on the tiles, smell, etc. A good place for a single not spending too much time in the room. TV very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Saabfan
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and well located. Definately not a luxury hotel but well maintained and boasting a friendly and helpful staff. An excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, Great location”
Reviews.Author: co90210
Reviews.Content: The Buchan is a small, but clean property. Our room had a tiny (I mean tiny) bathroom -other rooms use a shared bathroom at the end of the hall. The beds were a bit on the lumpy side and the TV is also small...but if you aren't interested in spending time in your room, this is a great place to stay because of the location / value. You are only blocks from the beach as well as Stanley Park. If you get there early, they have storage for your bags so you can hit the sites right away. The hotel is in a nice neighboorhood with lots of tress. Rent some beach cruisers and see the town !

Reviews.Title: “Misunderstanding resolved quickly, fairly”
Reviews.Author: Omaha73
Reviews.Content: In June I booked a reservation for rooms in late July. Several days later I called to cancel the reservation due to a change in my travel plans. Due to a misunderstanding that I was partially responsible for, my cancellation wasn't recognized and my credit card was charged for one night's stay when I didn't show up to stay at the Buchan. I recently called the hotel to straighten out the misunderstanding. After explaining the problem, the hotel agreed to reverse the room charges, even though I wasn't able to provide them a cancellation number. I appreciate the way I was treated so fairly and will plan to stay at the Buchan when I return to Vancouver some day. I do know its location near Stanley Park and Robson Street is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Munbun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simple and basic which is all you need if you need a room for a couple of nights. The tree lined street is extremely quiet and you can walk to Stanley Park and English Bay Beach within minutes. The hotel had a relaxed atmosphere and the double room was adequate and clean. The bathroom was tiny and there was no room to move about at all. The staff are very friendly and provide helpful advice. Take your key with you if you are staying out later than 11pm. I would stay here again if I ever return to Vancouver. We paid around $120 per night for an en suite double room in the middle of July which is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere99
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the Buchan Hotel is a budget hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet residential West-End neighborhood. It is easy walking distance to Stanley Park, the English Bay beach, and restaurants on Denning St. We got an executive room for two nights. The room was a decent size and met all our expectations. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They appear to have 1-2 parking spots you can reserve for an extra $10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Buick54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early May. Could not believe the value and location. We were lucky it was low season and got a room ( shared bathroom ) for C$60 plus tax. The hotel is an old property but well maintained and clean. There is a community lounge area with free coffee and newspapers daily.The staff were excellent, most helpful and very friendly, a highlight of our trip. The hotel is located in a quiet residential West End street near Stanley Park. We were lucky to catch the end of the cherry blossoms and tulips in the street. Not a 5 star property with all the mod cons but very suitable for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for place to sleep - no frills”
Reviews.Author: FishNutz
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a no frills place to store your luggage and a clean place to lay your head at night - dont expect Marriott quality pillows. As already noted… this is an older building – located in quiet residential area. The front desk staff was always helpful and honest in their assessments of place to go and how to get there. Couple of things to note: Front door locks at 23:00, don’t go out without your room key… our room was close to front door and at some point in the morning someone knocked and continued knocking on the front door until….well I ignored it and fell back to sleep…not sure of what the outcome was. As with any older building, there are the creaks and squeaks…take it for what it is – an old building. We had a rental car and paid the 10.00 a day for the parking permit for a dedicated parking site. This really made it much easier than trying to determine the ins and outs of Vancouver’s street parking (well worth the investment as we saw dozens of parking tickets everywhere we went). When we come back to Vancouver we will stay here again. Bottom line: very affordable, location awesome and rooms are clean

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Old Fashion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JadeLiam
Reviews.Content: This Hotel/Hostel is very simple old fashion three stories building. The Hotel has several large historic pictures of Vancouver, the city. We loved the location as well. It is very close to everything in English Bay, the Standley Park, many shops and restaurants. The price is not bad either given the location of this Hotel. This Hotel is a great budget Hotel. You share bathroom and shower room, bath tubs. There are two bathrooms on each floor. Sharing bathroom was not a problem at all for us. The room is simple but comfy. Nice firm bed and a TV in the room. No phone in the room, but public phone located in main lobby. Anyway, this Hotel located in 1906 Haro St. To get there is to take Beach Ave to Chilco St. than will intersect with Haro. Jade

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but basic accommodations”
Reviews.Author: calligcat
Reviews.Content: The Buchan has a great location -- a quiet neighborhood off of Denman Street, with all its restaurants -- but I wouldn't want a prolonged stay there. Our room was small with cheap furniture, but at least it was clean -- just shabby and dreary. We had the smallest bathroom imaginable!

Reviews.Title: “No elevator or A/C but just the right location!”
Reviews.Author: Nolita
Reviews.Content: Relatives in Vancouver suggested we book a room here due to its price range and location near Stanley Park, eateries, etc. The location was great. Lots of eateries, gelato shops, 2 blocks to the Park, close to shopping and other conveniences for a traveler including banks, markets, UPS counter to ship back extra items we didn't want to carry back home. We stayed in room 47, one flight up from the lobby which is already up a short flight of steps from the street. There is no elevator (unexpected, the topic never came up) and luckily we were able to manage our bags. We're a physically fit middle-aged couple from NYC. The $98/night room with private bath didn't have A/C. There was a ceiling fan which helped but we seemed to have arrived during an unusual hot spell. The bathroom was tiny and yet it had the basics. However, I wondered about the accomodations for individuals who are larger than we are. We are both under 5'7" and slender.The overall room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The reception desk personnel were friendly. There is a restaurant downstairs, but not part of the property. We got what we were seeking: a low cost but clean room in a safe location in a lively neighborhood. We spent most of our time out, of course. Casual Asian places were geared towards younger people (music) but the food was tasty and well cooked. There is a nearby breakfast place called White Spot which provides eggs, breakfast meats, toast, coffee, etc. for under $5.00. We enjoyed our city visit!

Reviews.Title: “Located in heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: sandyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: HI Friends, We booked this hotel after reading reviews from trip advisor.They don't offer any online booking.So we called them to make a reservation.They have shared bath rooms and private bath rooms.When we called them they they asked us which room we would like to book.We reserved room with private bath room.Front desk people are very friendly and helpful.After five days we got confirmation letter from them. I liked this hotel a lot because of it's location.It is located on Haros street in heart of dontown.Few blocks from famous Stanley park,beach and busy shoping street Robson street.All restaurants are walkable. Only minus point is it is very old one.You can feel that ambience.But,the service is great.First we booked one queen bed room for four days.When i entered and open the room I got stinky smell.So,I went asked for another room.They give us one king bed room which is very good(no smell) in down stairs.But the view from top floor room is great. Our four day stay was great we enjoyed the downtown alot and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: jaybe
Reviews.Content: Had 4 nights here. Was in a tree lined street. Minutes from Stanley Park, Denman Street which has restaurants galore, and either short walk to Downtown or bus to Downtown. We had a shared bathroom room but never had to wait. The lounge was a great place to have a coffee and read the paper. and other guests There was also a laundry for guests. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but dated”
Reviews.Author: OxfordshireCooker
Reviews.Content: The hotel came recommended by Lonely Planet and for the one night we stayed it was fine. The room was clean and there was a decent shower but the decor is very dated and there were numerous items which needed fixing (windows, coat-hooks etc). In short, it's OK for the price and a short stay but we'd have been a little uncomfortable if we'd had to stay any longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Horizontall laid back at the Buchan”
Reviews.Author: Hermitstar
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind that this is a budget hotel it is excellent. The staff are extremely hospitable and friendly and will put themselves out for your comfort. I have stayed there a total of 6 times and plan two more visits this year. It is ideal if you are moving on up country. The great thing is that it is so close to Stanley Park and the Lost Lagoon and it is so cool, after a hard year's work to get up early, collect a coffee and miffin from Bojangles (a block away) and sit in the warm morning light overlooking the Lost Lagoon and the creatures around it. A perfect antedote. I have stayed at other hotels but nothing compares to the Buchan. I don't want to spend a fortune on a hotel - I go to Canada for the tranquility and kindness of the people. I find that the large hotels are so undistinctive that you could be anywhere and after an 11 hour flight I want to know I'm yards away from Stanley Park And in a district so laid back as to be almost horizontal.

Reviews.Title: “A little tatty and dated!”
Reviews.Author: Angii
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Buchan partly because of the reviews we'd read on Tripadvisor, partly because of the price and partly because of the location. When we first arrived we were quite frankly disappointed. The hotel is dated and tatty. I appreciate that it is a budget hotel but do not feel that this excuses the owners from keeping it in a basic state of repair. We could not lock our windows, the sink moved and a porcelain tap that had been stuck back together with glue promptly collapsed in my partners hand when he turned on the hot water! We felt that a simple coat of paint would have made this hotel feel so much better, and that the furniture could do with upgrading. To be fair the location is good, the staff were helpful and the rooms were cleaned everyday – buts it’s hard to make a room look nice and comfortable when the decor is shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: colourmix
Reviews.Content: As many of the other reviewers have written, the Buchan is a budget hotel - so it is cheap. We booked a Double-Occupancy room for the Labor Day weekend. Our room had 1 queen bed and 1 twin bed. There was a small closet, desk/chair and a tiny (14") TV. The bathroom seemed like an afterthought - it was tiny! But it was also clean, with good hot/cold water flow. Clean towels, which were replaced every day. There's cable also. On the downside: 1. The room and furniture looked worn. The building itself is quite old and it shows - for example, our bathroom door would not shut properly. 2. Most of the rooms in the hotel have a shared bath in the hallway. So you'll occasionally see disheveled (and half-naked!) people standing in the corridors waiting for a bathroom to get free. 3. The hotel does not have parking. Overnight street parking is not easy, but not impossible. Over Labor day weekend, we spent an average of 10 minutes every night looking for a spot. On the upside: 1. The hotel is very quiet 2. They have a nice bar/restaurant in the basement 3. Very close to Stanley Park, Denman Street. Walking distance from English Beach The Buchan attracts a special kind of traveller - the type who doesnt care much for comforts, and is quite social - there's a common sitting room in the lobby where we found fellow residents every evening to have a chat with. We saw that the clientele was mostly non-US. Some people were travelling with children too. You would never confuse the Buchan for a Marriott, let alone a Westin or Omni. But we really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option, nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: stpaul66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a leafy residential neighborhood that's a short walk from the lively English Bay Beach area, and all the restaurants and shop along Denman Street. The exterior of the building is quite nice, and the interior hallways are very nice, including hardwood floors. It's also quite near Stanley Park. I thought the location was excellent. However, it is a bit of a hassle to get to the heart of downtown and Gastown -- it's a bit too far to walk, so you'll have to rely on public transport or taxis. Staff is very friendly and helpful in getting around town. Let's make it clear -- this is a budget hotel. The rooms are pretty spartan, and the carpet and some of the amenities are a little bit worn. Also, there's no air conditioning, which can make things quite warm during hot stretches. (Which, are uncommon along the B.C. coast, it should be noted.) Rooms were pretty clean, though, and the hotel had a nice sitting room and storage for bags and bikes. It's not the Hilton, but it also doesn't have the prices of the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations perfectly!”
Reviews.Author: PFGWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Vancouver recently served as the staging area for an extended camping vacation in British Columbia with my two teenage sons. I was looking for an inexpensive hotel near English Bay. I can't remember the exact words, but the tour book I used described the Buchan Hotel as a clean, no-frills, budget hotel, with a great location. That's exactly what I was looking for, and that's exactly what I found. The English Bay area is my favorite part of Vancouver, so the location couldn't be beat. Although we opted for a room with a bath, it was made pretty clear to me, both through my guidebook and on the Buchan Hotel Web site, that most rooms do not have private baths. This helped set my expectations properly. The room had the bare essentials, the bed was comfortable, and everything was nice and clean. If you're looking for a luxury hotel, and really have to have a hair dryer and other ammenities, then the Buchan is not right for you. On the other hand, if you're looking for an inexpensive, comfortable, clean place to stay, in the hippest part of Vancouver, the Buchan Hotel may be just what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible,Awful Baaaaaaaaaaad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place posing as a historic hotel in july of 2005, Thinking it was a charming older hotel in a good location at a resonable price. Well it is old and shows every bit of it. No Maintenance since the day it was built in 1926 or whatever. We rented the Room with a private Bath and lo and behold it was in the basement. as we made our way there bags of trash were piled up on the stairway and we had to step over them carrying our bags. That was the good part when we finally got to the room and opened the door my wife and i were horrified by what we saw. Faucets dripping, Mold on the Tile in the Shower, Furniture that looked like it was thown together from a Thrift store and no A/C and it was about 82 degrees when we arrived. Asked at the front desk for a fan and was given a fan about 8 inches in diameter and had to get it started with my finger. Opened the window and there was a bench outside with a homeless guy camped out. Now if we had paid 50.00 for this room i could understand a few problems. but we paid 119.00 plus 10.00 for parking. i Felt totally ripped off.This place is the pits. There is no way they should be renting a room as horrible as this.Luckily i only rented for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding value”
Reviews.Author: Nth_RooCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on short notice, same day in fact, and booked through the VERY helpful airport tourist information. The place was unbelievable. Very clean, warm and comfortable. The rate was exceptional and the staff were very friendly. It was unbelievable for such a central hotel. It was just off the main street in downtown. I did stay and I will again. Go here if you like cheap, friendly accomodation. And who doesn't like that?!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Content: I love a good bargain too, but this place was no bargain. It was plain awful. The first sign that this was not going to be a pleasant experience was the overwhelming smell as you enter the lobby. The room was tiny and everything in it was at least 60 years old. No phone, no hairdryer, etc. The tub had so much mildew in it, I wouldn't have worn bare feet in it. While the staff was very friendly and the location is great, I couldn't bring myself to even stay there for one night. The only redeeming part of this whole disaster was the fact I was only charged half of one night's rate for leaving after 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Buchan Hotel with a large group of friends (Singles On Sailboats) who flew in and chartered 8 boats to sail the Gulf Islands. The day we flew in was quite warm, 9/5, and there is no air conditioning - some rooms had fans. There also is no elevator and hauling bags and sailing gear up to the second or third floor was a nuisance. However, the rooms were clean and the windows did open - and the location, just a couple blocks from everything, was fabulous. There is no food service but the restaurant in the lower level (NO connection to the hotel) was outstanding for dinner. We stayed one Friday night and came back a week later for a Saturday night - the staff was very helpful with maps and reserving cars to take us to the airport early in the morning. I would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can't expect a 5 star hotel for this price, but it is clean and in a wondeful location. Staff very helpful and always keen to share their knowledge with you. Hotel needs renovation but at this price excellent value. If you want all the extras, pay double the price. If you want a clean, well situated hotel with limited facilities, enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “On target for the bargain hunter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found it a great overall value. But you should know the negatives: the spartan rooms can seem pretty stark at first, they can get stuffy on a warm day, & there are no phones or clocks in the rooms or an ice machine anywhere. However, the very basic furniture is in good condition, the rooms and the baths (both private and shared) are quite clean, the staff is very friendly, and the location is fantastic (quiet area with a restaurant strip a block away that has a wide variety of good choices). It appears to attract a wide mix of young & old, straight & g/l, singles & couples, N. Americans & internationals. And the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “True European hotel a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller, prettier, less used version of the Sylvia which was many Seattlites' destination during the 70's and 80's. It is quieter and closer to the park, and is just perfect for those not wanting to spend their time in Vancouver in their rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite it's great location on a quiet street in the West End, between Stanley Park and Denman, the Buchan Hotel looks more like a dormitory/boarding-house harbouring dingy rooms that contain virtually no amenities - no iron, no hair dryer, no phone, no alarm-clock radio, no air-conditioning, no window screens. The hotel was established in 1926 and appears not to have been renovated since. My room had an old sink with faucets. Some rooms only have sinks and toilet and showers are shared. My room was tiny with a tiny little 13" television, not that I was planning on watching anything anyway. The only think the hotel had going for it was the friendly staff and ample tourist information. They offer free coffee and tea, but instead of milk or cream they only have Coffeemate (this seems to be everywhere in Vancouver). There is a fancy restaurant in the same building, which does not belong to the hotel but looks interesting, though it is only open evenings. It seems that there are no good accommodations with private bathrooms for under 100$ during high season in BC. Visitors are better off staying at the Sylvia Hotel, Rosellen Suites or Coast Plaza Suites, which are all nearby, otherwise at a bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a vacation in Vancouver .My grandson and I stayed at the Buchan Hotel .I decided to stay there after reading a favourable review on this site. I can say I was very pleased the staff were friendly and helpful and the location was great for anyone travelling witout a car as we walked to Stanly Park and had no problem getting a bus or trolley just a two minute walk to Denmam St.Room was very basic not a luxery hotel but more then made up for this in other ways

HotelInfo.Name: Buchan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1906 Haro St., Vancouver, British Columbia V6G 1H7, Canada
